channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Martin Shkreli, the so-called “pharma bro” who was widely criticized for raising the price of a lifesaving AIDS drug, has been released from federal prison https://t.co/LjW1oaIvok
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/6gJDzXAxEy https://t.co/rC9K3QleYt
U.K. inflation jumped to a forty-year-high in April, the highest level posted by an industrialized nation since the start of the global price surge https://t.co/pAQoxvqdq1

As Russian setbacks in Ukraine have mounted, critical voices have grown louder. One retired colonel, appearing on state TV, cautioned viewers that “the situation will clearly get worse for us.” https://t.co/FyqX3kthJw

Exclusive: China will block promotions for senior officials whose spouses or children hold significant assets abroad, people familiar with the matter said, as Beijing eyes Western sanctions on Russia https://t.co/PdgoZOJ3pk
A 16-foot-wide, red-and-peach painting by Jean-Michel Basquiat has been sold for for $85 million at Phillips, continuing the art market's recent hot streak https://t.co/vbYjisP9iz

Melvin Capital is shutting down and returning cash to investors, capping a reversal for a firm that lost big on the meme-stock rally in 2021 and bets on fast-growing companies this year https://t.co/POi5qjWVrs
The cargo surge swamping U.S. ports for almost two years is starting to overwhelm the Port of New York and New Jersey https://t.co/Mncxt34iJI
Tesla was recently dropped from an ESG index. Elon Musk isn’t happy about it. https://t.co/b7oL0O56cW
The head of the Chinese central bank’s monetary-policy department has been removed from his position and is being investigated by the country’s top anticorruption agency https://t.co/fciyJDNjEk
A group of Republican senators is looking to curtail the power big asset managers like BlackRock and Vanguard have over public companies https://t.co/3uwW80Fb5Y
The Dow fell more than 400 points, pulling back a day after rallying as the stock market continued its sharp swings https://t.co/dB6fi5FRyY

New York University gave Taylor Swift an honorary doctorate in fine arts, giving her a chance to impart wisdom to the class of 2022 during a commencement speech at Yankee Stadium https://t.co/Y3Ky1INZqk
Getting out of spending $44 billion on Twitter would take pressure off Elon Musk’s finances—but lawyers say the contract offers him few ways to back out https://t.co/XqshkMs2GH
Safety regulators are investigating the role of Autopilot in a fatal Tesla Model S crash that left three people dead https://t.co/hOrSzXBtyd
Elon Musk’s concern over Twitter bots may be a way to renege on his commitment to buy the company, explains @DoubleLJSquared #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/PoTPs3wwSM https://t.co/4n1ndV4nru
President Biden is invoking the Defense Production Act to increase baby-formula production and authorizing the use of commercial aircraft to import supply https://t.co/sFVEBNxluj
Breaking: Melvin Capital is shutting down, capping a reversal for a firm that lost big on the meme-stock rally in 2021 and on bets on fast-growing companies this year https://t.co/bXgx8riaWM

Dozens of confirmed or suspected cases of monkeypox have been detected in the U.S., U.K., Spain and Portugal, in a puzzling outbreak of a disease that is rarely detected outside Africa https://t.co/th4q5mZZnU
Tesla was recently dropped from an ESG index. Elon Musk isn’t happy about it. https://t.co/3GNZzegtwe
YouTube star Logan Paul explains why not everyone is cut out to be an influencer. #WSJFuture https://t.co/UYblnWCAXo https://t.co/34gF2ZCwaq

Germany’s ruling coalition is seeking to strip former chancellor Gerhard Schröder of his office in the country’s parliament over increased criticism of his refusal to distance himself from Russian President Vladimir Putin https://t.co/1bfoG3iDdz

The Department of Homeland Security has suspended the creation of a new government board intended to support efforts to combat online disinformation, in the face of widespread criticism from conservatives who accused its mission of being Orwellian https://t.co/zgcByfIFBV
The Dow slid more than 1,100 points and the Nasdaq lost 4.7% as weak earnings reports by retailers raised fears of a recession https://t.co/BGkhQE8M2p
Frontier Airlines CEO Barry Biffle explains why higher airfares could persist for years #WSJFuture https://t.co/oG5PRoaCEO https://t.co/CXlFyuTEsy
Martin Shkreli, the so-called “pharma bro” who was widely criticized for raising the price of a lifesaving AIDS drug, has been released from federal prison https://t.co/lcWbNeeNpJ

Special counsel John Durham’s team says a lawyer for Hillary Clinton sought to involve the FBI in a partisan plot to undermine rival Donald Trump. The defense rejects the charge as nonsensical. https://t.co/qIARbqQ1fL

A 21-year-old Russian tank-unit officer pleaded guilty to firing several shots at an unarmed man, in Ukraine’s first war-crimes trial since Russia’s invasion. Moscow has denied targeting civilians. https://t.co/iEFqe3tvzb
There are signs Elon Musk may be getting cold feet a few weeks after he agreed to buy Twitter for $44 billion. Here are the Tesla CEO’s options should he try to exit the deal. https://t.co/NAdJNFUv3F

Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell says the central bank needs to see that inflation pressures are abating to determine how to calibrate its approach to setting interest rates #WSJFuture https://t.co/1Gn6pMV6uV https://t.co/jCgor4rBaf

The U.S. extended a limited license held by Chevron that allows the oil company to maintain its operations in Venezuela and negotiate future business in an attempt to encourage talks between Nicolás Maduro's government and the U.S.-backed opposition https://t.co/aPNgKR2AdA
When Russia invaded Ukraine, U.S. stock exchanges suspended trading in most Russian stocks listed in New York. They skipped these two. https://t.co/YN8eVmQT4o
A Russian soldier admitted to killing an unarmed civilian in the first war crimes trial since the invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/51yfSUSeWX

Finland and Sweden formally applied to join NATO, a move that signals a historic shift in European security. Both nations have been on a trajectory to increase their military spending. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/JlpzDrRaAU https://t.co/czInoU3n7K
Flight data indicates someone in the cockpit intentionally crashed a China Eastern jet in March, killing 132 people, say people familiar with an early U.S. review https://t.co/po4qHa036u
The European Union’s executive agency has proposed for the first time offering up to $9.5 billion to help Ukraine pay its bills through the rest of 2022, matching U.S. plans https://t.co/euY84H32yz
Few thought Germany could untangle its "catastrophic" reliance on Russian energy. In months, it has slashed use of Russian gas from 55% to 35%. https://t.co/2dA3ZanJIu
Heard on the Street: Elon Musk’s new Twitter diligence is as questionable as the bots he wants to ban https://t.co/y1TAOgYO4Y
Apple has paused plans to bring employees back to the office three days a week—up from two—following complaints from some workers https://t.co/vUGfacPb8Z
J Balvin, who managed to break out as a global superstar with songs in Spanish, is now working to break the stigma of mental health issues to the Latin community https://t.co/bFs3P2ca5Z

Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal posted a series of tweets defending the company’s ability to fight spam accounts. Elon Musk responded with multiple tweets, including one that solely said: 💩 https://t.co/2c3GNxBabs
Finland and Sweden have applied for NATO membership, a move that, if approved, would fundamentally transform the security landscape of Northern Europe https://t.co/SAr8ZpN2dS
JPMorgan Chase shareholders objected to a roughly $50 million retention bonus for CEO Jamie Dimon and voted against the bank’s compensation plan https://t.co/55lxWvujaB
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/59QowtVVJ7 https://t.co/keGnTWH0xV
Netflix said it is cutting about 150 employees in a new round of layoffs as the streaming company grapples with slowing revenue growth and a shrinking subscriber base https://t.co/2DLShs0Vv4
A 200-foot-long wildlife overpass under construction in Los Angeles aims to help the long-term survival of mountain lions and other animals. https://t.co/sWKL0PhImo

Bo Hines has won the Republican nomination for U.S. House in North Carolina's 13th Congressional District, the AP projects. The former college football player was endorsed by Donald Trump. https://t.co/U8lmdLBuoJ
North Carolina Rep. Madison Cawthorn, a freshman incumbent whose time in office was beset by blunders, has conceded defeat to state Sen. Chuck Edwards in the GOP primary https://t.co/t6oswq6zxB
Few thought Germany could untangle its "catastrophic" reliance on Russian energy. In months, it has slashed use of Russian gas from 55% to 35%. https://t.co/y8MWQGyNGO
In a closely watched GOP primary, North Carolina Rep. Madison Cawthorn is trailing State Sen. Chuck Edwards with 99% of the vote counted https://t.co/h0JOizbp32
